newsitem.title: USA: BEFORE THE BELL -- Loctite up on raised bid.
newsitem.headline: BEFORE THE BELL -- Loctite up on raised bid.

text.p: Loctite Corp shares traded at 61-3/4 from 60-3/8 preceding Thursday's U.S. market on news of Henkel KGaA raising its bid to $61 per share from $57.75 for the 65 percent of Loctite it does not already own.
The news came after Wednesday's market close, and much of the Loctite rise, to 61-1/2, came in after-hours trade last night.
Henkel also said the revised offer is subject to a friendly merger agreement, superceding the previous unwelcome tender offer Henkel has made for Loctite stock.
Barefoot Inc shares jumped to 15-1/2 from 12-3/4 before the market open on this morning's announcement of ServiceMaster LP's $16 per share acquisition of the lawncare company.
Oakley Inc shares were pounded to 11 from 15-3/8 after the company said it expects fourth quarter income to fall below the current consensus forecast of $0.16 per share.
Oakley also said it does not expect any fourth quarter orders from Sunglass Hut International Inc, news that knocked Sunglass Hut shares to 7-3/8 from 8-1/4.
Gymboree Corp shares fell to 23-1/4 from 27-3/4 after the company said this morning November same-store sales fell 15 percent, a trend that if continued will most likely hurt earnings.
Morgan Stanley cut the stock to neutral from outperform.
In other pre-open trade, MCI Communications rose to 32-1/4 from 31-3/4, Intel climbed to 130-1/4 from 129-1/2, Microsoft added 1/4 to 153-1/2 and Sun Microsystems added one to 59-1/4.
